\chapter*{HW1: Car Brand Classification}

\section*{Hardware}

The following specs were used to create the original solution.

\begin{itemize}
\item Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS
\item Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-9600K CPU @ 3.70GHz
\item GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
\end{itemize}

\section*{Installation}

All requirements are detailed in requirements.txt. 

\texttt{bash=
\$ pip install -r requirements.txt
}

\section*{Dataset Preparation}

\section*{Prepare Images}

The data directory is structured as:

\texttt{
data
  +- training\_data
  $\vert$ images
  $\vert$ training\_labels.csv
  +- testing\_data
  $\vert$ images
  $\vert$ testing\_labels.csv
}

\subsection*{Download Official Image}

Download and extract train.zip and test.zip. If the Kaggle API is installed, run following command.

\texttt{bash=
\$ kaggle competitions download -c cs-t0828-2020-hw1
\$ unzip cs-t0828-2020-hw1.zip
\$ mkdir data
\$ cp -r training\_data/training\_data/ data/
\$ cp training\_labels.csv data/training\_data/
\$ cp -r testing\_data/testing\_data/ data/
\$ rm -rf cs-t0828-2020-hw1.zip training\_data/ training\_labels.csv testing\_data/
}

\section*{Training}

To train models, run following commands.

\texttt{bash=
\$ train main.py
}

The results from every epoch will be automatically saved at \texttt{./saved/} and the structure is the following:

```
saved
  +- ResNet18
  $\vert$  +- pkls
     $\vert$ checkpoints
  $\vert$  +- preds
     $\vert$ submissions
  $\vert$ train\_acc.txt
  $\vert$ time.txt

```

\end{document}
